intro: Oreoherzogia pumila f. vestita, commonly known as the dwarf heartleaf orchid, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive tubular shape. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
